definition: to stop/to pause/to arrange/to lay out/to kowtow/to stamp (one's foot)/at once/classifier for meals, beatings, scoldings etc: time, bout, spell, meal

sentences.english: When Horton the elephant heard a small noise.
sentences.chinese: 這時大象霍頓聽到了微弱的聲音。

sentences.english: He has a red Hol den Commodore station wagon.
sentences.chinese: 他有一個紅色的霍頓旅行車。

sentences.english: Horton looked up with his face white as chalk.
sentences.chinese: 可憐的霍頓臉色煞白，擡起頭來。
並非巧合的是，霍頓是黑人。

sentences.english: Captain Houghton is a native of Candler, N. C.
sentences.chinese: 霍頓上尉是北卡羅來納州坎德勒人。
但是霍頓稱這些批評爲“嚇阻戰術。”
哈斯把賭注下在霍頓一方。

sentences.english: Together, the Mayor and Horton need to work together to save Whoville.
sentences.chinese: 最終，大象霍頓和無名鎮的市長要聯手拯救無名鎮。

sentences.english: Yeah, Horton, she's sending you a bunny with cookies.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，霍頓，她派了會做餅乾的兔子來。
